result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Christopher Edward McMillian

records.addlTxt: Received and Filed:  State's Notice of Expert Testimony.
Received and Filed:  Notice of Intent to Use DNA Evidence at Trial.
Received and Filed.
Received and Filed:  State's Motion in Limine.

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Christopher Edward McMillian.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference.  Court set final pretrial and jury trial dates upon request from the defense.  Defense acknowledges receipt of discovery.  Court ordered all substantive motions to be filed by 11-10-2022 and all responses to be filed by 12-08-2022 or they will be deemed waived.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Final pre-trial scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for January 9, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed:  Motion to Adjourn

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian appeared by video.  Attorney James Edgar Toran not in court.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Attorney Toran is unavailable.  Court rescheduled hearing to tomorrow morning.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 10-12-2022

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Christopher Edward McMillian.  Attorney Patrick O'Keefe in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for status conference.  Defense requests another status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 09-27-2022

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in court.  Attorney James Edgar Toran in court for Christopher Edward McMillian.  Prosecuting attorney Stephanie Krueger in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE. Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests a status date.  Court set date as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Status conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 08-31-2022

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in court by video with Attorney James Edgar Toran who appears in person.  Edward OBrien appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 07-11-2022

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in court, appear by video.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. Attorney Toran in trial this week. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed: Pretrial Services Supervision Report - 06-09-2022
Received and Filed.

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in Court with Attorney James Edgar Toran as a friend of the Court.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Case in Court for Preliminary hearing. Parties appeared in Room 504 of the Courthouse. Discussion placed on the record. Defendant QUALIFIES for Public Defender Representation; however, the Public Defender's Office has NOT been able to appoint counsel for Defendant. Attorney Toran advised the Court that he is willing to accept a Public Defender Appointment. Additionally, due to the nature of the charges and the felony intake schedule, case TRANSFERRED TO JUDGE SHELTON, BRANCH 40.
Court ordered case adjourned for Preliminary hearing, Branch PE. Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

22RM023959  Actual Date Bond Posted with * Sheriff
5/3/2022

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in court in person.  John Daniel Flynn appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Br 10 Judge Havas.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 20, 2022 at 10:30 am.
JusticePoint Supervision Report, filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in court with attorney Jeff Allen Schwarz.  Defendant Christopher Edward McMillian in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Christopher Edward McMillian appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
